course_title: Special Topics: Political Science: Race and Extralegal
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 7 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as AAS 385 5)
(This course considers extralegal violence as a political tool of coercion, repression, and resistance. Moving from theories of onset, to outcomes, to reconciliation, this course engages with social science research as well as literary texts. Students will gain a sense of the relationship between politics, race, and extralegal violence in Georgia and throughout the United States.)
course_description: Selected topics and problems in political science. Content will vary in successive offerings of this course. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 3858, Section #: 6, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 4-5:15p, Instructor: K. Crabtree, Status: Open
